Race.SpecificTitle: Monroe Special School Dist. Prop. No. 1 -- 14.41 Mills - SB - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
City of Monroe Special School District Propositions
Proposition No. 1
(Millage Renewal)
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Monroe Special School District (through the Monroe City School Board, acting as the governing authority thereof), as a special school district acting under the authority of Article VIII, Section 10 of the Louisiana Constitution of 1974, and other constitutional and statutory authority, be authorized to continue to levy and collect a tax of fourteen and forty-one hundredths (14.41) mills on all the property subject to taxation in said school district (an estimated $5,200,000.00 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year) for a period of ten (10) years, commencing with the year 2017 and ending with the year 2026, for the purpose of maintaining and operating the city schools of the Monroe City School Board?

Race.SpecificTitle: Monroe Special School Dist. Prop. No. 2 -- 6.15 Mills - SB - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
City of Monroe Special School District Propositions
Proposition No. 2
(Millage Continuation)
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Monroe Special School District (through the Monroe City School Board, acting as the governing authority thereof), as a special school district acting under the authority of Article VIII, Section 10 of the Louisiana Constitution of 1974, and other constitutional and statutory authority, be authorized to continue to levy and collect a tax of six and fifteen hundredths (6.15) mills on all the property subject to taxation in said school district, said mills to represent a 0.01 mills increase over the 6.14 mills authorized to be levied through the year 2016 pursuant to an election held on April 29, 2006 (an estimated $2,200,000.00 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year) for a period of ten (10) years, commencing with the year 2017 and ending with the year 2026, for the purpose of giving and providing additional aid and support to the city schools of the Monroe City School Board, provided proceeds from said tax will not be used for payment of salaries of professional personnel?
